summary: Held at White Lake State Park in Tamworth, New Hampshire, the White Lake Ultras is a festive endurance event featuring 6, 12, and 24-hour timed races. Runners navigate a scenic 2-mile single-track loop that winds through forested lakefront trails and sandy shorelines, offering a high-energy 'party' atmosphere ideal for both seasoned athletes and beginners.
uniqueFeatures: Beachside Start and Finish: The race course prominently features a start and finish line on the beach, allowing runners to transition from forested single-track trails to sandy lakefront 'beach vibes' every two miles.

Costume-Friendly Festive Atmosphere: Unlike more somber mountain races, this event highly encourages costumes and fosters a social environment where runners and crews can camp on-site and celebrate throughout the weekend.

Highly Accessible PR Course: With only 50 feet of vertical ascent per loop and a focus on a short, technical-friendly trail, it is specifically designed for runners looking to set personal distance records in a supported, looped format.
